verses.verse: וַיְהִ֥י <WH1961> vay-Hi came דְבַר־ <WH1697> de-var- The word יְהוָ֖ה <WH3068> Yah-weh of the LORD אֵלַ֥י <WH413> 'e-Lai to me לֵאמֹֽר׃ <WH559> le-Mor. came again unto me saying

וְאַתָּ֣ה <WH859> ve-'at-Tah and you בֶן־ <WH1121> ven- Now thou son אָדָ֔ם <WH120> 'a-Dam, of man שָׂ֥א <WH5375> sa take up עַל־ <WH5921> 'al- over צֹ֖ר <WH6865> tzor for Tyrus קִינָֽה׃ <WH7015> ki-Nah. a lamentation

וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ <WH559> ve-'a-mar-Ta And say לְצ֗וֹר <WH6865> le-Tzor, unto Tyrus; הַיֹּשְׁבֹתֵי hai-yo-she-vo-tei כהַיֹּשֶׁ֙בֶת֙ <WH3427> hai-yo-She-vet abide קעַל־ <WH5921> 'al- at מְבוֹאֹ֣ת <WH3996> me-vo-'Ot the entrance יָ֔ם <WH3220> Yam, of the sea רֹכֶ֙לֶת֙ <WH7402> ro-Che-let [which art] a merchant הָֽעַמִּ֔ים <WH5971> ha-'am-Mim, of the people אֶל־ <WH413> 'el- about אִיִּ֖ים <WH339> 'i-Yim isles רַבִּ֑ים <WH7227> rab-Bim; for many כֹּ֤ה <WH3541> koh Thus אָמַר֙ <WH559> 'a-Mar Thus saith אֲדֹנָ֣י <WH136> 'a-do-Nai the Lord יְהוִ֔ה <WH3068> Yah-weh, GOD צ֕וֹר <WH6865> Tzor O Tyrus אַ֣תְּ <WH859> 'at you אָמַ֔רְתְּ <WH559> 'a-Mart, thou hast said אֲנִ֖י <WH589> 'a-Ni I am כְּלִ֥ילַת <WH3632> ke-Li-lat I [am] of perfect יֹֽפִי׃ <WH3308> Yo-fi. beauty

בְּלֵ֥ב <WH3820> be-Lev [are] in the midst יַמִּ֖ים <WH3220> yam-Mim of the seas גְּבוּלָ֑יִךְ <WH1366> ge-vu-La-yich; Thy borders בֹּנַ֕יִךְ <WH1129> bo-Na-yich thy builders כָּלְל֖וּ <WH3634> kal-Lu have perfected יָפְיֵֽךְ׃ <WH3308> ya-fe-Yech. thy beauty

בְּרוֹשִׁ֤ים <WH1265> be-ro-Shim of fir trees מִשְּׂנִיר֙ <WH8149> mis-se-Nir of Senir בָּ֣נוּ <WH1129> Ba-nu They have made לָ֔ךְ Lach, אֵ֖ת <WH853> 'et כָּל־ <WH3605> kol- all לֻֽחֹתָ֑יִם <WH3871> lu-cho-Ta-yim; all thy [ship] boards אֶ֤רֶז <WH730> 'E-rez cedars מִלְּבָנוֹן֙ <WH3844> mil-le-va-nOn from Lebanon לָקָ֔חוּ <WH3947> la-Ka-chu, they have taken לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת <WH6213> la-'a-Sot to make תֹּ֖רֶן <WH8650> To-ren masts עָלָֽיִךְ׃ <WH5921> 'a-La-yich. of

אַלּוֹנִים֙ <WH437> al-lo-Nim [Of] the oaks מִבָּ֔שָׁן <WH1316> mib-Ba-shon, of Bashan עָשׂ֖וּ <WH6213> 'a-Su have they made מִשּׁוֹטָ֑יִךְ <WH4880> mish-sho-Ta-yich; thine oars קַרְשֵׁ֤ךְ <WH7175> kar-Shech thy benches עָֽשׂוּ־ <WH6213> 'a-su- have made שֵׁן֙ <WH8127> shen [of] ivory בַּת־ <WH1323> bat- the company אֲשֻׁרִ֔ים <WH839> 'a-shu-Rim, of the Ashurites מֵאִיֵּ֖י <WH339> me-'i-Yei [brought] out of the isles; כִּתִּיִּם kit-ti-yim ככִּתִּיִּֽים׃ <WH3794> kit-ti-Yim. Chittim ק

שֵׁשׁ־ <WH8336> shesh- Fine linen בְּרִקְמָ֤ה <WH7553> be-rik-Mah with broidered work מִמִּצְרַ֙יִם֙ <WH4714> mi-mitz-Ra-yim from Egypt הָיָ֣ה <WH1961> ha-Yah became מִפְרָשֵׂ֔ךְ <WH4666> mif-ra-Sech, was that which thou spreadest forth לִהְי֥וֹת <WH1961> lih-Yot became לָ֖ךְ lach לְנֵ֑ס <WH5251> le-Nes; to be thy sail תְּכֵ֧לֶת <WH8504> te-Che-let blue וְאַרְגָּמָ֛ן <WH713> ve-'ar-ga-Man and purple מֵאִיֵּ֥י <WH339> me-'i-Yei from the isles אֱלִישָׁ֖ה <WH473> 'e-li-Shah of Elishah הָיָ֥ה <WH1961> ha-Yah became מְכַסֵּֽךְ׃ <WH4374> me-chas-Sech. was that which covered

יֹשְׁבֵ֤י <WH3427> yo-she-Vei The inhabitants צִידוֹן֙ <WH6721> tzi-dOn of Zidon וְאַרְוַ֔ד <WH719> ve-'ar-Vad, and Arvad הָי֥וּ <WH1961> ha-Yu become שָׁטִ֖ים <WH7751> sha-Tim were thy mariners לָ֑ךְ Lach; חֲכָמַ֤יִךְ <WH2450> cha-cha-Ma-yich thy wise צוֹר֙ <WH6865> tzOr [men] O Tyrus הָ֣יוּ <WH1961> Ha-yu become בָ֔ךְ Vach, הֵ֖מָּה <WH1992> Hem-mah they חֹבְלָֽיִךְ׃ <WH2259> choe-La-yich. [that] were in thee were thy pilots

זִקְנֵ֨י <WH2205> zik-Nei The ancients גְבַ֤ל <WH1380> ge-Val of Gebal וַחֲכָמֶ֙יהָ֙ <WH2450> va-cha-cha-Mei-ha and the wise הָ֣יוּ <WH1961> Ha-yu become בָ֔ךְ Vach, מַחֲזִיקֵ֖י <WH2388> ma-cha-zi-Kei repairing בִּדְקֵ֑ךְ <WH919> bid-Kech; your seams כָּל־ <WH3605> kol- All אֳנִיּ֨וֹת <WH591> o-ni-Yot all the ships הַיָּ֤ם <WH3220> hai-Yam of the sea וּמַלָּֽחֵיהֶם֙ <WH4419> u-mal-la-chei-Hem with their mariners הָ֣יוּ <WH1961> Ha-yu become בָ֔ךְ Vach, לַעֲרֹ֖ב <WH6148> la-'a-Ro were in thee to occupy מַעֲרָבֵֽךְ׃ <WH4627> ma-'a-ra-Vech. thy merchandise

פָּרַ֨ס <WH6539> pa-Ras They of Persia וְל֤וּד <WH3865> ve-Lud and of Lud וּפוּט֙ <WH6316> u-Fut and of Phut הָי֣וּ <WH1961> ha-Yu were in בְחֵילֵ֔ךְ <WH2428> ve-chei-Lech, were in thine army אַנְשֵׁ֖י <WH376> 'an-Shei your men מִלְחַמְתֵּ֑ךְ <WH4421> mil-cham-Tech; of war מָגֵ֤ן <WH4043> ma-Gen the shield וְכוֹבַע֙ <WH3553> ve-cho-Va' and helmet תִּלּוּ־ <WH8518> til-lu- they hanged בָ֔ךְ Vach, הֵ֖מָּה <WH1992> Hem-mah they נָתְנ֥וּ <WH5414> na-te-Nu in thee they set forth הֲדָרֵֽךְ׃ <WH1926> ha-da-Rech. thy comeliness

בְּנֵ֧י <WH1121> be-Nei The men אַרְוַ֣ד <WH719> 'ar-Vad of Arvad וְחֵילֵ֗ךְ <WH2428> ve-chei-Lech, with thine army עַל־ <WH5921> 'al- were on חוֹמוֹתַ֙יִךְ֙ <WH2346> cho-mo-Ta-yich [were] upon thy walls סָבִ֔יב <WH5439> sa-Viv, round about וְגַ֨מָּדִ֔ים <WH1575> ve-Gam-ma-Dim, and the Gammadims בְּמִגְדְּלוֹתַ֖יִךְ <WH4026> be-mig-de-lo-Ta-yich were in thy towers הָי֑וּ <WH1961> ha-Yu; become שִׁלְטֵיהֶ֞ם <WH7982> shil-tei-Hem their shields תִּלּ֤וּ <WH8518> til-Lu they hanged עַל־ <WH5921> 'al- on חוֹמוֹתַ֙יִךְ֙ <WH2346> cho-mo-Ta-yich upon thy walls סָבִ֔יב <WH5439> sa-Viv, round about הֵ֖מָּה <WH1992> Hem-mah they כָּלְל֥וּ <WH3634> kal-Lu perfect יָפְיֵֽךְ׃ <WH3308> ya-fe-Yech. thy beauty

תַּרְשִׁ֥ישׁ <WH8659> tar-Shish Tarshish סֹחַרְתֵּ֖ךְ <WH5503> so-char-Tech [was] thy merchant מֵרֹ֣ב <WH7230> me-Ro by reason of the multitude כָּל־ <WH3605> kol- of all ה֑וֹן <WH1952> Hon; of all [kind of] riches בְּכֶ֤סֶף <WH3701> be-Che-sef with silver בַּרְזֶל֙ <WH1270> bar-Zel iron בְּדִ֣יל <WH913> be-Dil tin וְעוֹפֶ֔רֶת <WH5777> ve-'o-Fe-ret, and lead נָתְנ֖וּ <WH5414> na-te-Nu they traded עִזְבוֹנָֽיִךְ׃ <WH5801> iz-vo-Na-yich. in thy fairs

יָוָ֤ן <WH3120> ya-Van Javan תֻּבַל֙ <WH8422> tu-Val Tubal וָמֶ֔שֶׁךְ <WH4902> va-Me-shech, and Meshech הֵ֖מָּה <WH1992> Hem-mah they רֹֽכְלָ֑יִךְ <WH7402> ro-che-La-yich; they [were] thy merchants בְּנֶ֤פֶשׁ <WH5315> be-Ne-fesh the persons אָדָם֙ <WH120> 'a-Dam of men וּכְלֵ֣י <WH3627> u-che-Lei and vessels נְחֹ֔שֶׁת <WH5178> ne-Cho-shet, of brass נָתְנ֖וּ <WH5414> na-te-Nu they traded מַעֲרָבֵֽךְ׃ <WH4627> ma-'a-ra-Vech. in thy market

מִבֵּ֖ית <WH1004> mib-Beit They of the house תּוֹגַרְמָ֑ה <WH8425> to-gar-Mah; of Togarmah סוּסִ֤ים <WH5483> su-Sim with horses וּפָֽרָשִׁים֙ <WH6571> u-fa-ra-Shim and horsemen וּפְרָדִ֔ים <WH6505> u-fe-ra-Dim, and mules נָתְנ֖וּ <WH5414> na-te-Nu traded עִזְבוֹנָֽיִךְ׃ <WH5801> iz-vo-Na-yich. in thy fairs

בְּנֵ֤י <WH1121> be-Nei The men דְדָן֙ <WH1719> de-Dan of Dedan רֹֽכְלַ֔יִךְ <WH7402> ro-che-La-yich, [were] thy merchants אִיִּ֥ים <WH339> 'i-Yim isles רַבִּ֖ים <WH7227> rab-Bim many סְחֹרַ֣ת <WH5506> se-cho-Rat [were] the merchandise יָדֵ֑ךְ <WH3027> ya-Dech; of thine hand קַרְנ֥וֹת <WH7161> kar-Not horns שֵׁן֙ <WH8127> shen of ivory; וְהֹובְנִים ve-hov-nim כוְהָבְנִ֔ים <WH1894> ve-ha-ve-Nim, ebony קהֵשִׁ֖יבוּ <WH7725> he-Shi-vu they brought אֶשְׁכָּרֵֽךְ׃ <WH814> 'esh-ka-Rech. thee [for] a present

אֲרָ֥ם <WH758> 'a-Ram Syria סֹחַרְתֵּ֖ךְ <WH5503> so-char-Tech [was] thy merchant מֵרֹ֣ב <WH7230> me-Ro by reason of the multitude מַעֲשָׂ֑יִךְ <WH4639> ma-'a-Sa-yich; of the wares of thy making בְּ֠נֹפֶךְ <WH5306> Be-no-fech with emeralds אַרְגָּמָ֨ן <WH713> 'ar-ga-Man purple וְרִקְמָ֤ה <WH7553> ve-rik-Mah and broidered work וּבוּץ֙ <WH948> u-Vutz and fine linen וְרָאמֹ֣ת <WH7215> ve-ra-Mot and coral וְכַדְכֹּ֔ד <WH3539> ve-chad-Kod, and agate נָתְנ֖וּ <WH5414> na-te-Nu they occupied בְּעִזְבוֹנָֽיִךְ׃ <WH5801> be-'iz-vo-Na-yich. in thy fairs

יְהוּדָה֙ <WH3063> ye-hu-Dah Judah וְאֶ֣רֶץ <WH776> ve-'E-retz and the land יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל <WH3478> Yis-ra-'El, of Israel הֵ֖מָּה <WH1992> Hem-mah they רֹכְלָ֑יִךְ <WH7402> ro-che-La-yich; they [were] thy merchants בְּחִטֵּ֣י <WH2406> be-chit-Tei wheat מִ֠נִּית <WH4511> Min-nit of Minnith וּפַנַּ֨ג <WH6436> u-fan-Nag and Pannag וּדְבַ֤שׁ <WH1706> u-de-Vash and honey וָשֶׁ֙מֶן֙ <WH8081> va-She-men and oil וָצֹ֔רִי <WH6875> va-Tzo-ri, and balm נָתְנ֖וּ <WH5414> na-te-Nu they traded מַעֲרָבֵֽךְ׃ <WH4627> ma-'a-ra-Vech. in thy market

דַּמֶּ֧שֶׂק <WH1834> dam-Me-sek Damascus סֹחַרְתֵּ֛ךְ <WH5503> so-char-Tech [was] thy merchant בְּרֹ֥ב <WH7230> be-Ro in the multitude מַעֲשַׂ֖יִךְ <WH4639> ma-'a-Sa-yich of the wares of thy making מֵרֹ֣ב <WH7230> me-Ro for the multitude כָּל־ <WH3605> kol- of all ה֑וֹן <WH1952> Hon; of all riches בְּיֵ֥ין <WH3196> be-Yein in the wine חֶלְבּ֖וֹן <WH2463> chel-Bon of Helbon וְצֶ֥מֶר <WH6785> ve-Tze-mer wool צָֽחַר׃ <WH6713> Tza-char. and white

וְדָ֤ן <WH1835> ve-Dan Dan וְיָוָן֙ <WH3120> ve-ya-Van also and Javan מְאוּזָּ֔ל <WH235> me-'uz-Zal, going to and fro בְּעִזְבוֹנַ֖יִךְ <WH5801> be-'iz-vo-Na-yich in thy fairs נָתָ֑נּוּ <WH5414> na-Tan-nu; occupied בַּרְזֶ֤ל <WH1270> bar-Zel iron עָשׁוֹת֙ <WH6219> 'a-shOt bright קִדָּ֣ה <WH6916> kid-Dah cassia וְקָנֶ֔ה <WH7070> ve-ka-Neh, and calamus בְּמַעֲרָבֵ֖ךְ <WH4627> be-ma-'a-ra-Vech were in thy market הָיָֽה׃ <WH1961> ha-Yah. become

דְּדָן֙ <WH1719> de-Dan Dedan רֹֽכַלְתֵּ֔ךְ <WH7402> ro-chal-Tech, [was] thy merchant בְבִגְדֵי־ <WH899> ve-vig-dei- clothes חֹ֖פֶשׁ <WH2667> Cho-fesh in precious לְרִכְבָּֽה׃ <WH7396> le-rich-Bah. for chariots

עֲרַב֙ <WH6152> 'a-Rav Arabia וְכָל־ <WH3605> ve-chol and all נְשִׂיאֵ֣י <WH5387> ne-si-'Ei and all the princes קֵדָ֔ר <WH6938> ke-Dar, of Kedar הֵ֖מָּה <WH1992> Hem-mah they סֹחֲרֵ֣י <WH5503> so-cha-Rei in these [were they] thy merchants יָדֵ֑ךְ <WH3027> ya-Dech; with thee בְּכָרִ֤ים <WH3733> be-cha-Rim in lambs וְאֵילִים֙ <WH352> ve-'ei-Lim and rams וְעַתּוּדִ֔ים <WH6260> ve-'at-tu-Dim, and goats בָּ֖ם bam סֹחֲרָֽיִךְ׃ <WH5503> so-cha-Ra-yich. were your customers

רֹכְלֵ֤י <WH7402> ro-che-Lei The merchants שְׁבָא֙ <WH7614> she-Va of Sheba וְרַעְמָ֔ה <WH7484> ve-ra'-Mah, and Raamah הֵ֖מָּה <WH1992> Hem-mah they רֹכְלָ֑יִךְ <WH7402> ro-che-La-yich; they [were] thy merchants בְּרֹ֨אשׁ <WH7218> be-Rosh with chief כָּל־ <WH3605> kol- of all בֹּ֜שֶׂם <WH1314> Bo-sem of all spices וּבְכָל־ <WH3605> u-ve-Chol all אֶ֤בֶן <WH68> 'E-ven stones יְקָרָה֙ <WH3368> ye-ka-Rah and with all precious וְזָהָ֔ב <WH2091> ve-za-Hav, and gold נָתְנ֖וּ <WH5414> na-te-Nu they occupied עִזְבוֹנָֽיִךְ׃ <WH5801> iz-vo-Na-yich. in thy fairs

חָרָ֤ן <WH2771> cha-Ran Haran וְכַנֵּה֙ <WH3656> ve-chan-Neh and Canneh וָעֶ֔דֶן <WH5729> va-'E-den, and Eden רֹכְלֵ֖י <WH7402> ro-che-Lei the merchants שְׁבָ֑א <WH7614> she-Va; of Sheba אַשּׁ֖וּר <WH804> 'ash-Shur Asshur כִּלְמַ֥ד <WH3638> kil-Mad [and] Chilmad רֹכַלְתֵּֽךְ׃ <WH7402> ro-chal-Tech. [were] thy merchants

הֵ֤מָּה <WH1992> Hem-mah They רֹכְלַ֙יִךְ֙ <WH7402> ro-che-La-yich These [were] thy merchants בְּמַכְלֻלִ֔ים <WH4360> ve-mach-lu-Lim, in all sorts בִּגְלוֹמֵי֙ <WH1545> big-lo-Mei clothes תְּכֵ֣לֶת <WH8504> te-Che-let [of things] in blue וְרִקְמָ֔ה <WH7553> ve-rik-Mah, and broidered work וּבְגִנְזֵ֖י <WH1595> u-ve-gin-Zei and in chests בְּרֹמִ֑ים <WH1264> be-ro-Mim; of rich apparel בַּחֲבָלִ֧ים <WH2256> ba-cha-va-Lim with cords חֲבֻשִׁ֛ים <WH2280> cha-vu-Shim bound וַאֲרֻזִ֖ים <WH729> va-'a-ru-Zim and made of cedar בְּמַרְכֻלְתֵּֽךְ׃ <WH4819> be-mar-chul-Tech. among thy merchandise
